Package pageObjects

Class SoftwareTestingPage

java.lang.Object
pageObjects.CourseDetailsPage
pageObjects.SoftwareTestingPage
public class SoftwareTestingPage extends CourseDetailsPage
Applying the page pattern, all the methods related to the page where the details of the software testing course are specified are implemented in this class. This is a Selenium Page Object.

    • getAssignmentsLinkElements

      public List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> getAssignmentsLinkElements()
      Get all assignment links that are specified for the course. Do not include resource links.
      Returns:
      List A list with each WebElement the link to particular assignment on the Software Testing course page.

    • getNumberOfAssignmentLinks

      Returns:

      Checks if there are any assignments listed at all on the Software Testing page
      Returns:
      boolean True if there are 1 or more assignments listed on the Software Testing page.

    • verifyAssignmentsLinkExistence

      public List<Integer> verifyAssignmentsLinkExistence()
      Check for each assignment link that the link exists. Give warning when link does not exist in Step
      Returns:
      List where each item is an integer, that is the number of the assignments with non-existent links

    • doesLinkExists

      public boolean doesLinkExists(String urlText)
      The linkExists() method takes a URL as a parameter and performs an HTTP HEAD request to check the response code. The HTTP HEAD request is a type of HTTP request method that is used to retrieve only the header information for a given resource, without fetching the actual content of the resource. It is useful when you are interested in obtaining metadata or checking the status of a resource without the need to download its entire contents.

      If the response code is HTTP_NOT_FOUND (which is the constant for 404), it means that the link does not exists on the server. The method will return true. Otherwise, it returns false.

      Parameters:
      urlText - URL of the link in String format.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the link exists on the server.

    • formatLinkExistenceWarning

      public String formatLinkExistenceWarning(List<Integer> nonExistentLinks)
      Precondition: there is at least one non-existent link. Formats the warning text of the non-existent links
      Parameters:
      nonExistentLinks - A list of Integers tht are the number of the assignments with non-existent links
      Returns:
      String WarningText with formatted numbers (comma's, and, ...)

    • formatNumListToText

      public String formatNumListToText(List<Integer> numList)
      Precondition: at least two numbers to format Formats a list of integers to a string of the format 1, 2 and 3 Used to make warnings and assertion texts.
      Parameters:
      numList - List of integers
      Returns:
      String Formatted integers in text form

    • verifyAssignmentsLinkFormat

      public List<Integer> verifyAssignmentsLinkFormat()
      Implementation for the step 'Then the user should verify the link format of each assignment link'. For each assignment listed, checks that the link is of the format '/system/files/uploads/courses/Testing/assignment[NR].pdf' Gives assertion if the layout differs for one of the assignments.
      Returns:
      List of integers where each item is assignment number that does not have the right format.

    • formatLinkFormatAssertion

      public String formatLinkFormatAssertion(List<Integer> nonFormattedLinks)
      Formats the assertion for the links that are not formatted correctly
      Parameters:
      nonFormattedLinks - A list of Integers tht are the number of the assignments with non-existent links
      Returns:
      String AssertionText with formatted numbers

    • provideStudentGroup

      public void provideStudentGroup(String name, String group)
      Save the input that the user has given as class variables.
      Parameters:
      name - Full student name that needs to be verified.
      group - Group number that needs to be verified.

      public int getNumberOfGroups()

      Returns:

    • getDate

      public LocalDate getDate(int groupNumber)
      Reforms date sentence of correct group-number to a date object.
      Parameters:
      groupNumber - Int that is the group number that is linked with a certain date
      Returns:
      date LocalDate object that is the date where the group with this group number is linked to.

    • getPresenters

      public List<String> getPresenters(int groupNumber)
      Gets the names of people that are in a group and need to present.
      Parameters:
      groupNumber - Int that is the group number where u want the presenters from.
      Returns:
      presenters List of Strings where each item is a full name of a presenter.

    • getOpponents

      public List<String> getOpponents(int groupNumber)
      Gets the names of people that are in a group and have the role of opponent.
      Parameters:
      groupNumber - Int that is the group number where u want the opponents from.
      Returns:
      List of Strings where each item is a full name of an opponent.

    • getGroupNumbers

      public List<Integer> getGroupNumbers(String studentName)
      Search the group number of the group where a student is presenter, and where a student is opponent by the name of the student. Assumes that if the student is in any group, that the student is two groups (one as presenter and one as opponent).
      Parameters:
      studentName - The full name of the student.
      Returns:
      List of Integer that is either null when the student is not in any groups, or contains two Integers, where the first one is the presenter group and the second one is the opponent group.

    • inAnyGroup

      public boolean inAnyGroup()
      Check if the student is in any group.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the student is in one or more groups.

    • verifyStudentGroupWarning

      public boolean verifyStudentGroupWarning()
      Check if the given student is either an opponent or a presenter in the given group number.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the student is part of the student group, either as opponent or presenter (or both).

    • presencePresenter

      public String presencePresenter()
      Searches the date where the given student should present on. Formats that date and puts it into an output message.
      Returns:
      String Informational message that contains the date the student should present on.

    • presenceOpponent

      public String presenceOpponent()
      Searches the date where the given student should play the role of opponent on. Formats that date and puts it into an output message.
      Returns:
      String Informational message that contains the date the student should present on.
